hedline.hl1: National Briefing | South: Georgia: City Of Lithonia Is Broke

abstract.p: Lithonia, Ga, population 2,200, misses insurance payment for lack of funds, leaving employees and vehicles, including police cars, without coverage (S)

block.p: The City of Lithonia is broke and missed its insurance payment of $42,000, leaving its employees and vehicles without liability insurance, said Marcus Lloyd, the mayor pro tem. Mr. Lloyd said city police officers who had been put on desk duty or driven to calls by the DeKalb County police were now temporarily suspended, and the city, which has a population of 2,200, laid off 9 of 20 employees on Friday. Mr. Lloyd said the city was appealing for help to Gov. Sonny Perdue and the Georgia Municipal Association. A spokesman for the governor, Dan McLagan, said, ''That's not what the discretionary fund is for.''
